fr.umlv.wallj.display

Class Displayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.umlv.wallj.display.Displayer

  • public class Displayer
extends java.lang.Object
    An object allowing to open a window a draw the game. Also manages the events to ensure they are valid, and give the position of the last click. The b field is the board associated with the displayer. It contains all the objects that must be drawn. The context field is the context of the application. It is used to render the window with context.renderFrame() method. The (xClick, yClick) fields are the position of the last valid click in the window, converted to match with the Board dimension.
    Author:
    Sevrin Gosset - Denis Biguenet

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(Path path)
        Draws the current frame. If path is not null, draws it.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to draw. If it's null, only the board will be drawn.

      • getXClick

        public int getXClick()
        Returns the abscissa of the last valid click (i.e. inside the board)
        Returns:
        the abscissa of the click

      • getYClick

        public int getYClick()
        Returns the ordinate of the last valid click (i.e. inside the board)
        Returns:
        the ordinate of the click

      • waitEvent

        public int waitEvent()
        Returns an event from the user. If there is no event, do nothing. If the users pressed a keyboard button, exits the application, and if the user clicked inside the board, fills the xClick and yClick fields with the coordinates of the click, then convert them into the board's corresponding case coordinate.
        Returns:
        -2 if there is no event or a false event, -1 if the event is a click inside of the board, or the value of the pressed key.

      • drawMessage

        public void drawMessage(java.lang.String[] messages)
        Draws several messages, represented by an array of Strings. Each string will be drawn on a new line, and all the text will be centered in both axes.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to draw.

      • drawInterface

        public void drawInterface(int level)
        Draws the interface of the game, with the name of the game and the current level.
        Parameters:
        level - the current level to display.
